title: Lismore’s Southern Cross University On Lockdown After Threatening Phone Calls
text:
Thanks for signing up!

Southern Cross University has placed its Lismore campus on emergency lockdown after receiving phone threats this afternoon, police confirm.

NSW Police have denied reports of an active shooter situation at the campus, but confirmed officers from Richmond Police District and specialist resources are in attendance.

Citing an Ambulance NSW spokesperson, The Northern Star reports one paramedic crew is at the scene in an “operational standby” capacity.

Earlier, a university spokesperson advised students to “remain inside until given the all-clear,” and told potential visitors to avoid the campus.

Important message:

Our Lismore campus is under emergency lock-down.

Police are currently on-site and all students and staff are advised to remain inside until given the all-clear.

Anyone planning to visit the campus at present should postpone. — Southern Cross Uni (@SCUonline) September 17, 2019

Nearby Rivers Secondary College Lismore High is also under lockdown, with principal Chris Williams advising parents not to collect their children until further notice.

More to come.
description: Visitors have been advised to avoid the area.
